block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
FILM

New Brunswick The New Jersey Film Festival, Summer 2007. Schedule and information: njfilmfest.com. Through Aug. 23. $4 to $10. New Jersey Media Arts Center, 72 Lipman Drive. (732) 932-8482. Nyack Sing-along screening of ''The Wizard of Oz.'' June 10 at 5 p.m. $6 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
FOR CHILDREN

Marlton Father's Day celebration, with readings and family activities. Thursday at 10 a.m. Free. Borders, 515 Route 73 South. (856) 985-5080. Montclair Mr. Ray, interactive children's concert. Ages 2 to 8. June 10 at 3 p.m. $16. Montclair Art Museum, 3 South Mountain Avenue. (973) 746-5555. Newark ''The Cat in the Hat,'' children's program presented by Ann Coppola and Kate Pak. June 16 at 11 a.m. Free. Branch Brook Branch, 235 Clifton Avenue. (973) 733-6388.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Cape May Cape May Music Festival: ''Sunday Night at the Movies,'' performed by George Mesterhazy and his jazz trio, with vocalists. June 10 at 8 p.m. $10 to $22. Cape May Convention Hall, 720 Beach Drive at Stockton Avenue. (609) 884-5404. Clinton Narobi Trio and Earl Pickend. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $10. Red Mill Museum Village, 56 Main Street. (908) 735-4101. Edison Summer concert series: David Cedeno Orchestra, with the Robert Murdock Band. Thursday at 6 p.m. Free. Lake Papaianni, Route 27 and Municipal Boulevard. (732) 248-7312. Fair Lawn Fair Lawn Diamond Jubilee Band, wind band concert. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Thomas Jefferson Middle School, Morlot Avenue. (201) 794-2137. Hackensack Bergen Youth Orchestras; works by Beethoven, Vivaldi and others. June 10 at 4 p.m. $5 to $10. Bergen County Academies Auditorium, 200 Hackensack Avenue. (201) 837-1980. Hoboken Tones of Joy, soul. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Frank Sinatra Park, Frank Sinatra Drive, between Fourth and Fifth Streets. Madison The Sanofi-Aventis JazzFest 2007, presented by the New Jersey Jazz Society: Winard Harper Sextet, Earl May Quintet, Sarah Partridge, Bob Dorough and others. Through June 10. $35 to $45; two-day passes, $65 to $85. Drew University, 36 Madison Avenue. (800) 303-6557. Marlton Patty Blee, singer-songwriter. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Borders, 515 Route 73 South. (856) 985-5080. Montclair Celebration 3, with the Sydenham Synagogue Choir from South Africa. June 10 at 7:30 p.m. $15 to $100. Montclair State University Memorial Auditorium, Valley Road. (973) 773-9933. Morristown Happy and Artie Traum, folk. Friday at 8:30 p.m. $7. Minstrel Coffeehouse, Morristown Unitarian Fellowship, 21 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 335-9489. Morristown Morris Choral Society; Bernstein's ''Chichester Psalms'' and the premiere of R. Wayne Walters's Requiem in D Minor. June 10 at 2 p.m. $15 to $25. St. Mary's Abbey, Delbarton School, 230 Mendham Road. (973) 895-4142. Nyack Esera Tuaolo, former N.F.L. player and author of ''Alone in the Trenches,'' football clinic and book signing; part of the Gay Pride Rockland celebration, with outdoor family activities and carnival rides. June 10, 11:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Free. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741. Princeton Youth Jazz Festival, with Thursday Night Jazz, the Session, the Real Band, the Kevin Sun Quintet and others; presented by the Arts Council of Princeton. June 16, noon to 5 p.m. Free. Princeton Shopping Center, 301 North Harrison Street. (609) 924-8777. Ridgewood Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Yeomen of the Guard,'' performed by the Ridgewood Gilbert and Sullivan Opera Company. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Big Band Swing Machine. Thursday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Kasschau Memorial Shell, behind the Ridgewood Library. (201) 444-1776. Teaneck Vladimir Tsypin, violinist, and Thomas Osuga, pianist; concert celebrating early 20th century Jewish music. June 17 at 4 p.m. $10. Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue. (201) 836-8923. Watchung Sarah Jane Cion, jazz pianist, with her quartet. Friday at 8 p.m. $18. Watchung Arts Center, 18 Stirling Road. (908) 753-0190.
OUTDOORS

Belmar Annual New Jersey Seafood Festival, with food and wine, music and children's activities. Information: www.belmar.com. Through June 10. Admission: free. Silver Lake Park, Ocean Avenue, between Fifth Avenue and Sixth Avenue. (732) 681-3700. Milford Annual Father's Day celebration, with music, wine tasting, crafts and children's activities. June 17, noon to 5 p.m. Free admission; wine tasting, $5. Alba Vineyard, 269 Route 627. (908) 995-7800. Princeton Garden party open house, with tours, music and refreshments. June 10, 1 to 4 p.m. $5; reservations required. Drumthwacket House, Route 206. (609) 683-0057.
THEATER

Atlantic Highlands ''Nunsensations: The Nunsense Vegas Revue,'' musical comedy. Through June 23. $15 to $20. First Avenue Playhouse, 123 First Avenue. (732) 291-7552. Beach Haven ''Thoroughly Modern Millie,'' musical comedy by Dick Scanlan and Richard Morris. Through July 1. $17 to $27. Surflight Theater, Engleside and Beach Avenues. (609) 492-9477. Cape May ''Bad Dates,'' comedy by Theresa Rebeck. Through July 20. $10 to $28. Cape May Stage, Bank and Lafayette Streets. (609) 884-1341. Eatontown ''Crimes of the Heart,'' comedy by Beth Henley, presented by Over the Rainbow. Through June 30. $17 and $22. Eatontown Playhouse, Tower Market Shopping Center, 37-13 Route 35 North. (732) 460-0100. Leonia ''The Playwrights' Showcase,'' a collection of new plays by local playwrights: ''Garlic and Milk,'' by Robert Daria; ''The Inspector General Prepares for a Polygraph,'' by Blair Birmelin; ''God, Satan and Sarah,'' by Cary Gitter; ''The Lindy,'' by Kathleen Clark. Friday through June 17. $14 and $16. Civil War Drill Hall Theater, 130 Grand Avenue. (201) 947-9606. Long Branch ''Place Setting,'' premiere of the comedy by Jack Canfora. Through June 24. $25 to $40. New Jersey Repertory Company, 179 Broadway. (732) 229-3166. Millburn ''Pirates!'' Adapted from Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Pirates of Penzance.'' Through July 8. $23.25 to $72.25. Paper Mill Playhouse, 3 Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. Nutley ''Death of a Salesman,'' Arthur Miller's drama. Through June 23. $12. Nutley Little Theater, 47 Erie Place (off Brookfield Avenue). (973) 667-0374. Princeton ''Mrs. Packard,'' premiere of the drama by Emily Mann; presented with the Kennedy Center. Through June 10. $35 to $48. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Red Bank ''High School Musical,'' performed by Phoenix Productions. Friday through June 17. $22 to $29. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. Stony Point ''Half and Half,'' comedy by James Sherman. Through June 10. $15 to $30. Penguin Repertory Company, 7 Crickettown Road. (845) 786-2873. Sussex ''Greater Tuna'' by Jaston Williams, Joe Sears and Ed Howard, presented by the Tri-State Actors Theater. Through June 24. $17 to $27. Crescent Theater, 74 Main Street. (973) 875-2950. Teaneck ''Wonderland!,'' musical adaptation of Lewis Carroll's ''Through the Looking Glass.'' Through June 16. $15 to $18. Becton Theater, Fairleigh Dickinson University, 960 River Road. (201) 569-7710.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Belmar ''Made in the USA: Movies, Music and Advertising,'' vintage prints and posters. Friday through Sept. 8. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Pinnacle Galleries, 912 Belmar Plaza. (888) 590-9226. Clinton ''Gregory Perkel: Manuscripts of the Cardboard Culture,'' mixed-media show, with an annual national juried print exhibition and ''Wally Barnette: Recent Work.'' June 10 through Sept. 16. Artist talks by Mr. Perkel and Mr. Barnette: June 10 at 3 and 3:30 p.m. Donation: $3. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. Hopewell ''Wall to Wall'' and ''The Delaware at Dusk,'' urban wall art by Barbara K. Suomi, and photographs of the Delaware River by John Blackford. Through July 8. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. Lincroft ''Marsh Meditations: A Celebration of the Hamilton-Trenton Marsh,'' group show by artists from the Princeton Artists Alliance. Through June 10. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth Museum, Brookdale Community College, Newman Springs Road. (732) 747-2266. Montclair Studio Montclair's ''Summer Salon: What's New?'' Annual summer exhibit. Through June 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Montclair Public Library, 50 South Fullerton Avenue. (973) 744-0500. New Brunswick ''Natvar Bhavsar: The Dimensions of Color,'' paintings, and ''Through the Night: Children's Books Illustrations From the Rutgers Collection.'' Through July 22. ''Alone/Together: People in America Prints'' and ''Printmaking From the Soviet Estonia.'' Through July 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Jane Voorhees Zimmerli Art Museum, 71 Hamilton Street. (732) 932-7237. New Brunswick ''Eccentric Bodies,'' group exhibition of female nudes. Thursday through Aug. 3. Reception: Thursday, 5 to 7 p.m. Mason Gross School of the Arts, 33 Livingston Avenue. (732) 932-7511. Newark ''Artreach XV and Newark New Media,'' group shows. Thursday through July 12. Reception: Thursday, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. City Without Walls, 6 Crawford Street. (973) 622-1188. Newark ''Someday This Will All Be (Something Else),'' group landscape show. June 16 through July 14. Reception: June 16, 6 to 9:30 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, noon to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Gallery Aferro, 73 Market Street. Newark Erika Diamond, new sculptures. Hours: Thursdays, 6 to 9 p.m. Redsaw Gallery, 585 Broad Street. (973) 648-8275. Newark ''Mexicana: Discovering Mexican Popular Arts, 1919-1950.'' Through Nov. 25. ''The Art of Glass From Gallé to Chihuly,'' contemporary group show. Through Aug. 5. ''At the Movies: Edward Hopper's 'The Sheridan Theater.' '' Through Aug. 19. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., October through June; noon to 5 p.m., July through September. The Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6493. Oceanville ''Sightings: Recent Works by Doug and Mike Starn,'' photography. Through Aug. 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays noon to 5 p.m. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. South Orange ''Singularity in the Communal Tide: Culture and Identity in the Moment,'' group show. Through July 15. Curator talk and artist panel discussion: June 24 at 3 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Pierro Gallery, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7755. Stockton Recent works by David Baker. Hours: Mondays through Wednesdays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sunday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Riverbank Arts, 19 Bridge Street. (609) 397-9330. Summit ''J. G. Zimmerman: It Was One of These Moments,'' mixed-media show. Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Domo Gallery, 447 Springfield Avenue. (908) 608-0079. Tenafly ''Natural Moments,'' photographs by Itai Monnickendam. Through June 28. JCC on the Palisades, 411 East Clinton Avenue. (201) 569-7900. Trenton ''The Best of the Best and the First Annual Salon des Refusés,'' exhibition of work by regional and Trenton-area artists. Through June 24. $2 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Trenton City Museum, Cadwalader Park. (609) 989-3632. Union ''As I See It,'' photography by Jane H. Rapp. Through Wednesday. Les Malamut Art Gallery, 1800 Morris Avenue. (908) 851-5450. Washington Township Group show, with paintings, sculpture and photography. Through July 1. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Atrium Gallery, Bergen County Y, 605 Pascack Road. (201) 666-6610, Extension 222. West Long Branch ''Jacob Landau: Dialoguing with Humanity,'' original drawings, limited edition prints and more. Hours: Mondays through Wednesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. 800 and Ice House Galleries, Monmouth University, 400 Cedar Avenue. (732) 571-3512.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.

June 10, 1 to 4 p.m. $5; reservations required. Drumthwacket House, Route 206. (609) 683-0057.
